intro: Jaltomata cajacayensis, commonly known as the Cajacay nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Peru. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. It thrives in cool, temperate climates and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its native range.
